basics.name: Kew Wei Chian
basics.summary: R&D Engineer at Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI), focusing on AIoT systems, embedded systems, and cloud solutions. Experienced in large language models, computer vision, cybersecurity, and edge computing.

work.name: Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI)
work.position: R&D Engineer, AIoT Embedded Systems Application Development (R300)
work.summary: Building AIoT systems using large language models and computer vision; planning and deploying scalable solutions on Microsoft Azure.
highlights: Developed AIoT solutions combining LLMs and computer vision
Planned and deployed scalable cloud systems on Microsoft Azure

work.name: Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI)
work.position: Intern, AIoT Embedded Systems Application Development (R300)
work.summary: Focused on AI model conversion and deployment on embedded platforms.
highlights: Installed Ubuntu and Yocto on MTK Genio boards
Deployed ARMNN on Genio 350 and Genio 510, demonstrated object detection
Converted trained models for edge AI processors (Neuropilot, HailoRT)
Contributed to cloud service framework for model training, testing, deployment

work.name: Industrial Technology Research Institute (ITRI)
work.position: Intern, Private Cloud Computing Safety and Security
work.summary: Worked on NLP for cybersecurity and vulnerability analysis.
highlights: Applied LLMs to analyze cybersecurity data and trends
Authored PoC article on web scraping vulnerabilities and countermeasures

work.name: Huawei
work.summary: Assisted in software development for network technology solutions.
highlights: Built PyQt5 GUI with error handling

education.thesis: A Framework of Reproducible MITRE Lifecycle Extraction and Mapping with Enhanced-LLM

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Scheme
awards.summary: Contributed to research project on Deep Learning in Botnet Detection using SDN Spatial Correlations. Completed 140+ hours of research and 8 hours of training.

publications.name: Agentic Design Patterns: A Hands-On Guide to Building Intelligent Systems
publications.summary: A 406-page book introducing reusable design patterns for building intelligent systems with LLMs and autonomous agents. 100% of royalties donated to Save the Children.
